p: At the beginning of the New Millennium, the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus (CoV) outbreak created social and political alarm because of the threat of transmission of the highly life-threatening virus through international traveling from Asia. The big economical expansion of Asian countries and their international trade seemed to be hampered by the fear of contagion. Luckily, the outbreak was limited and the alert quickly returned. However, this outbreak raised attention to the fact that emerging infections originate largely from animals (zoonosis).
